learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role and importance of media buying and planning in the strategic advertising process.
Evaluate the characteristics and strengths of specific media channels and vehicles to reach desired target audiences.
Articulate the importance of advertising strategy and consumer behaviour in generating a successful media campaign.
Gain a deep level of knowledge of the various advertising media available, including features, trends and measurement.
Establish and apply media strategies to achieve strategic marketing objectives both effectively and cost efficiently in response to a client brief.

assessments.task_description:
You will select one (1) recent media campaign from a curated list provided in Blackboard and prepare a critical Impact Report evaluating the campaign’s effectiveness, execution, and broader impact. Your evaluation must be grounded in evidence‑based benchmarks, ethical reasoning, and contemporary media planning and buying frameworks. This assessment develops your ability to critically interrogate real-world media decisions using industry standards, research, and ethical considerations.

You are required to:

  • Conduct secondary research using reputable industry and academic sources to understand the marketing/advertising problem the campaign aimed to address.
  • Analyse the environmental, sociocultural, and market contexts that shaped the campaign’s creative strategy and media activations.
  • Investigate and collate the publicly identifiable media channels and vehicles in which the campaign (or its components) appeared. Many campaigns deploy multi-channel approaches; failing to identify the breadth of media used will limit your ability to produce a robust Impact Report.
  • Apply global benchmark criteria (e.g., WARC, IAB, IPA norms, channel‑specific attention/viewability/CPM benchmarks) to critically evaluate the campaign’s media effectiveness.
  • Assess the campaign’s ethical and societal implications using media ethics, regulatory standards, and moral reasoning.

A detailed Assessment Guide, Rubric, and Impact Report Template and Exemplars will be available on Blackboard.

AI Use Disclosure Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) tools may be used as supporting tools in completing this assessment task, provided their use is appropriately disclosed. You must use the AI Disclosure Statement template provided to declare any use of AI or MT. Failure to disclose AI use may constitute academic misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission will be via Blackboard. Detailed Submission Guidelines is provided in the assessment folder on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
28/04/2026 12:00 pm

All students are required to attend this seminar to pass the invigilated component of the assessment.
assessments.task_description:
This assessment item builds foundational competence in digital media measurement and responsible data practice. Students complete two industry‑recognised micro‑credentials and an invigilated reflection connecting credential learning to ethical and effective media planning, measurement, attribution modelling, and governance.

There are two components to this task:

  1. Completion of Measurement Micro‑credentials: Two Google Skillshop certifications (asynchronous; self‑paced)
  2. Critical Reflection: Invigilated, timed in‑class written reflection (8–10 minutes) with prompt

Approved Micro-credential Courses (Google Skillshop | free | self‑paced | online)

  • Google Ads Measurement Certification (2h 40m)
  • Develop skills in: Implementing and interpreting advertising measurement; KPI selection; conversion setup; linking analytics; translating insights into media actions. Enrol via course link provided in Blackboard.
  • AI‑Powered Performance Ads Certification (3h 58m)
  • Develop skills in: Google’s cross‑channel AI solutions; configuring/optimising AI‑assisted campaigns; aligning to marketing objectives; measurement implications. Enrol via course link provided in Blackboard.

Access & Support: Students will be given class time across the semester to progress these certifications. Additional study is expected outside class. To pass this assessment students must submit the following:

Submission

1.Credential Proofs of Completion (both courses): Use A2 submission templates provided on Blackboard to upload photo evidence of certificates (downloaded from Google Skillshop), and a verification link to the public credential page and/or badge.

  • If you cannot post a badge on LinkedIn for privacy reasons, submit the Skillshop public verification link instead (If you choose to post on LinkedIn, include the URL to your post and the hashtags #ADVT7512 #UQBusiness.)

2.Invigilated Critical Reflection (8–10 minutes | in class):

  • Completed under supervision during seminar.
  • Delivered as a timed written response with optional additional submission formats to Blackboard
  • Students will receive a series of prompts at the start to guide reflection.
  • No AI/MT tools or external resources may be used during the invigilated reflection.

A detailed assessment guide and reflection template and format instructions, submission guidelines, and comprehensive marking criteria/rubric for the Critical Reflection task will be provided in class and on the Assessment folder on Blackboard.

AI Use Disclosure Statement

You may use AI/MT tools as supporting tools while completing the micro‑credentials and preparing for class. You must disclose any AI/MT use in assessment artefacts using the AI Disclosure Statement template. AI/MT tools are not permitted during the invigilated reflection. Use may constitute misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment 3 (Part A): AI-Assisted Integrated Media Plan (Group)
assessments.due_date:
12/05/2026 12:00 pm

Following submission of your Media Plan, you will receive targeted feedback from the teaching team to help you strengthen and refine your team's Pitch (Part B) to the client.
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Notebook/ Logbook, Project
assessments.task_description:
Part A - AI-Assisted Integrated Media Plan (Group)

Working in teams of up to five students, you will form a student‑led media agency positioned as a competitive, ethical, and affordable alternative to traditional media agencies. Acting in this agency role, your team will receive a real client brief in class and will be expected to research, develop, and prepare an AI‑assisted integrated media plan that will be presented in Part B of this assessment.

This task requires your team to allocate roles, manage workflows, and collaborate to produce a coherent, evidence‑based, ethically responsible and strategically justified media plan that optimises budget, reach, frequency, impact, and delivers against the client’s marketing and advertising objectives.

Task Requirements

Your media plan must:

  • Demonstrate a clear strategic response to the client brief, grounded in audience research and insight development.
  • Present an evidence‑based, socially responsible and brand‑safe mix of media channels, formats, partner activations, and creative considerations.
  • Integrate AI‑assisted tools appropriately to support planning, forecasting, budget allocation, optimisation, and insight generation—while ensuring human oversight and critical reasoning guide all decisions.
  • Justify targeting choices, budget distribution, flighting/phasing, KPIs, measurement and evaluation approaches.
  • Address ethical implications, ESG considerations, misinformation and brand safety risks, and responsible data and AI governance.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of planning across a converging media landscape, avoiding unjustified over‑reliance on any single medium or platform.

Note: An unjustified or poorly supported concentration in one channel or partner will result in significant loss of marks. A detailed assessment guide, planning templates, submission instructions, and the full marking rubric will be provided on Blackboard.

AI Use and Governance Requirements in Part A

This assessment evaluates your ability to apply core media planning competencies alongside the responsible use of generative AI and machine assistance.

  • Judicious, transparent and ethical use of AI tools is expected, as appropriate for a contemporary media planning workflow.
  • AI tools must serve as co‑pilots, not substitutes, for analytical judgement, ethical reasoning, or strategic thinking.
  • Students must keep an AI Reflection Log throughout the task, noting:
  • tools used
  • purpose and rationale
  • reflections on opportunities, risks, and limitations
  • feelings, learning insights, and evolving perspective on AI in media work
  • Your AI Reflection Log will inform your AI Use Disclosure Statement, which must be submitted with your media plan.
  • Failure to submit the disclosure statement may constitute misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment 3 (Part B) Team Pitch - AI Assisted Integrated Media Plan (Group)
assessments.due_date:
Week 13 Mon - Week 13 Fri

Due to large cohort logistics, pitches will run both during designated seminar block and across Week 13. A live signup sheet and running order will be posted on Blackboard from Week 11. Teams must be present for their scheduled slot; late arrivals may forfeit the pitch unless special consideration applies.
assessments.task_description:
Part B assesses your team’s ability to effectively communicate and defend an AI‑assisted, insight‑driven media plan to a professional audience. You will present your plan as a student‑led media agency responding to a real client brief, demonstrating strategic clarity, ethical and brand‑safe decision‑making, and practitioner‑grade rationale for budget, media mix, and measurement.

Team Pitch Format & Timing

  • Pitch length: 15 minutes per team
  • Q&A: 5 minutes with panel (teaching team + industry/client panel as available)
  • Total per team: 20 minutes
  • Recording: All pitches are recorded for moderation and (where applicable) client selection and feedback.
  • This assessment includes a self and peer evaluation component worth 5% which each student must complete to receive their full marks.

Further details including detailed assessment guide, templates, helpful resources and marking rubrics will be available on Blackboard and clarified in class.

Use of AI in Part B

  • Allowed for preparation (e.g., scenario scoping, data checking, draft copy, visual layout), with disclosure and human oversight.
  • Not allowed during the live pitch/Q&A (no real‑time AI prompting, no AI‑generated voice‑overs in lieu of human speakers).
  • All content remains the team’s original analytical work; AI must not replace critical reasoning or ethical judgement.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Teams will submit their Pitch deck (including technical appendix and samples of creative executions), AI Use Disclosure Statements, (team-level) and individual peer evaluation. Full details of the Team pitch requirements including a detailed assessment guide and exemplars, submission guidelines, and marking criteria/rubric for the pitch will be provided in class and on the Assessment folder on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
